required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Effect of Blenderized Enteral Tube Feeds on Pediatric Upper Gastrointestinal Tract Physiology
clinical_study.official_title: Effect of Blenderized Enteral Tube Feeds on Pediatric Upper Gastrointestinal Tract Physiology

brief_summary.textblock: Blenderized diets consist of a wide range of table foods such as fruits, vegetables, meat and legumes, pureed in a blender and administered via gastrostomy tube. In a recent study, the investigators reported that children receiving blenderized feeds via gastrostomy had fewer total admissions and respiratory admissions, total emergency room visits, and improved gastrointestinal symptom scores compared to those fed formula. The goal of this project is to understand how these diets affect gastroesophageal reflux burden.

detailed_description.textblock: The investigators hypothesize that rates of gastroesophageal reflux will be lower in blenderized diets compared to formula. The investigators will determine if reflux burden as measured by multichannel intraluminal impedance/esophageal pH monitoring performed for clinical purposes differs between low viscosity conventional formula, medium viscosity commercial blenderized diet, and high viscosity commercial blenderized diet in 45 children receiving conventional formula via gastrostomy. All participants will receive each of the three test diets in random order in a 3-way crossover design. Results of gastric emptying scans will be recorded if done for clinical purposes.

primary_outcome.description: Number of total reflux episodes (acid and non-acid) by impedance

secondary_outcome.description: Total number of full-column reflux episodes by impedance
Percent of time esophageal pH < 4 by impedance
Average height of refluxate by impedance
Frequency of pulmonary and gastrointestinal symptoms from questionnaires during impedance

other_outcome.measure: Gastric emptying (percent of ingested contents remaining in stomach at 1 hour)
other_outcome.description: Gastric emptying scans by scintigraphy will be analyzed if performed for clinical reasons

arm_group.description: Elecare for first bolus, Nourish for second bolus, Real Foods Blends for third bolus
Nourish for first bolus, Real Foods Blends for second bolus, Elecare for first bolus
Real Foods Blends for first bolus, Elecare for second bolus, Nourish for third bolus

intervention.description: Elecare Jr is a standard pediatric elemental formula
Nourish is a commercially prepared blenderized tube feed that is formulated for pediatric use
Real Foods Blends is a commercially prepared blenderized tube feed that is formulated for pediatric use

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Age 1-21 years
- G-tube
- Able to tolerate bolus gastric feeds over 30 minutes
- Use of conventional enteral formula
- Undergoing impedance study for clinical purposes
Exclusion Criteria:
- History of allergy or intolerance to any component of the test diets
- History of Nissen fundoplication
- Current use of non-invasive pressure support (continuous or bi-level positive airway pressure)
